Dalla carovana al centro città abbandonato
Distruggi i laboratori d'assedio e muori una morte gloriosa.
Abbiamo cibo sufficiente per ora. Torna qui un'altra volta se vuoi essere d'aiuto!

Le città costiere hanno vita facile. Tutto è molto civile e l'unico pericolo è un pirata ogni tanto. 
 
La mia patria vicino alle Alpi non è così fortunata. Ogni inverno c'è scarsità di cibo e in città arrivano gli animali selvatici. La sopravvivenza è una lotta quotidiana.
 
Non voglio morire di fame. Ti prego, salvaci!
Usa il mercato per raccogliere cibo.
Eccellente! Navigano nella pietra!
Presumo che alle miniere la produzione sia ripresa, giusto? C'è ancora speranza per te.

Gli orsi sono il culmine della caccia. Non esiste un'emozione più forte di uno scontro diretto con un orso infuriato! \n \nDevi provarlo. Insisto! Se mi porti le prove di aver cacciato gli orsi, ti ricompenserò.

Noi greci siamo maestri nel creare dal nulla. La maggior parte della nostra gente non ha questo... senso dell'economia. 
 
Se vuoi sopravvivere a Massalia, devi sapere come usare un mercato. I mercati ti consentono di scambiare risorse con oro e quindi spendere l'oro per ottenere altre risorse. 
 
A nord c'è una terra fertile, ricca di foreste e animali. Trasforma la ricchezza della terra in freddo oro sonante.

Vedo che hai incontrato il nostro problema locale: gli oxubi. Passano il loro tempo a farmi venire i capelli bianchi. 
 
Per fortuna non godono dei favori delle altre tribù celtiche. I voconti non vorranno mai allearsi con Massalia stessa, ma sono certo che aiuteranno un'altra tribù celtica come loro. 
 
Mostra la tua buona volontà installando alcuni di quei bei boschetti. Così i voconti saranno invogliati a unirsi a te contro gli oxubi.

Tylis è in una posizione meravigliosa, ma è circondata da nemici. Siamo riusciti a mantenerla con la forza, ma cadrà, se rimane isolata. 
 
La Tracia ci separa dal resto della nazione celtica. Se riusciamo a espanderci nel loro territorio riusciremo a collegare le due parti del nostro territorio e mantenere sicura Tylis nei secoli. 
 
Abbiamo un avamposto abbandonato all'interno del territorio tracio. Utilizziamolo come base per la nostra nuova città.

Il lavoro nella nuova città procede bene. Purtroppo, il nostro successo crea nuovi problemi. 
 
I traci hanno notato le tue mosse furtive e la nostra nuova città non è passata inosservata. Siamo pronti alla difesa, ma facciamo qualcosa di meglio. 
 
Vai nella nostra nuova città e fanne la base delle tue operazioni. Se ripuliamo l'area dai traci, avremo tutto quello spazio per espanderci!
Gli auguri sono in sintonia con la natura, ma anche loro devono rispettarne la forza.

Quando si schiacciano i barbari in nome della civiltà e della giustizia, non si passa inosservati. Brenno del villaggio di Sens ha inviato un messaggio per chiedere un favore.
 
I barbari hanno un piccolo avamposto di ricognizione che usano per segnalare i punti deboli dei senoni. Finché l'avamposto rimane, i celti sono in pericolo. 
 
Dobbiamo aiutare Brenno e tutta la nazione celtica. Brucia tutto!
I nemici arrivano fra...
La flotta nemica arriva fra...
Non solo abbiamo protetto la città, ma ora abbiamo un esercito considerevole. Domani siamo in marcia!
Quando raggiunsero la vetta, guardarono in basso e videro l'intero mondo sotto di loro. Presto, Auggie sarebbe arrivato a casa.
Le prove di Auggie erano quasi giunte al fine!
Il cerchio di pietre è necessario per consacrare l'area della fiera.

La storia che mi piace di più raccontare è quella che rese Auggie l'augure un eroe. Vuoi sentirla? 
 
Un villaggio costruito sui fianchi delle Alpi fu colpito da una terribile malattia. Il villaggio era molto difficile da raggiungere e i sentieri erano infestati di banditi. 
 
Auggie sapeva cosa doveva fare. Radunò i suoi amici e insieme decisero di affrontare le Alpi un'altra volta. Avrebbero salvato il villaggio!

Ieri sera mi sono ritrovato coinvolto in una baruffa contro un tracio. Ho vinto, naturalmente, e lui ha giurato che un certo cavaliere tracio lo avrebbe vendicato. 
 
Questo cavaliere tracio pare sia un potente guerriero che difende la terra. Molti traci si sono innamorati di quella leggenda, quindi cercano di emulare il loro eroe. 
 
Dimostra ai traci che le loro leggende non sono all'altezza della nostra potenza. Sconfiggi più cavalieri traci che puoi!

Ottenere il carbone celtico richiede molta fatica e abilità. Se ne vuoi, devi prima fare un po' di lavoro.
 
L'unico giacimento locale è all'altra estremità di un fiume infestato dai predoni. Per arrivarci, dovrai superare furtivamente, distruggere e correre tra numerosi ostacoli e trappole dei nemici. Per ottenere aiuti per via, fornisci cibo a ognuno dei porti commerciali alleati. Potrebbero essere in grado di offrirti un potenziamento di velocità o imbarcazioni in più lungo la rotta.
 
Agisci e pensa in fretta: i predoni sono noti per i loro continui spostamenti di ostacoli e trappole. Buona fortuna.

Brenno è nei guai all'imbocco delle Termopili. La vicina Etolia ha radunato un esercito impressionante per rafforzare la difesa. 
 
Gli etoli sono nativi del posto e le loro città sono vicine. Se colpiamo le loro case, abbandoneranno le Termopili, dandoci l'occasione che ci serve. 
 
Insieme controlleremo metà dell'esercito. Troviamoci vicino alle città etoli per dare la terra alle fiamme!

Ogni anno i celti del posto celebrano una cerimonia per assicurarsi un buon raccolto. È sempre uno spettacolo meraviglioso! 
 
Quest'anno gli oxubi sono stati i implacabili nei loro assalti e buona parte della terra ne ha sofferto. Gli artigiani del villaggio sono fuggiti e devono assoldare nuovi operai. 
 
Ti prego, aiuta i celti a procurarsi tutto ciò di cui hanno bisogno. Al momento serve tutto l'oro che puoi trovare!
Navi nemiche distrutte
Leggendario: la terza volta di Damietta
Proteggi il centro città alleato facendo affondare le navi degli oxubi.

Mio marito non capisce il modo di lavorare della nostra gente. Protis credeva che bastasse distruggere le difese principali degli oxubi per costringerli a lasciar stare Massalia. 
 
Invece gli oxubi si stanno rivalendo su Lattes, appena fuori Massalia. Stanno cercando di evitarti passando alle loro forze navali. 
 
Ti prego, difendi Lattes. Costruisci torri di guardia, crea una flotta, fai quel che puoi per affondare le navi.

Grazie di tutto il tuo impegno a Massalia. Gli oxubi non riattaccheranno tanto presto. 
 
Un uomo di nome Brenno ha mandato un messaggio. È orgoglioso che tu non abbia dormito sugli allori dopo la Vindelicia e ti chiede di raggiungerlo a Tylis. Non devi far altro che seguire il Danubio verso ovest. 
 
Buona fortuna, amico. Succeda quel che succeda, sarai sempre il benvenuto a Massalia.

Ho dimenticato di dirti dell'avamposto che sta subendo un attacco? A volte mi scordo anche le cose più importanti... 
 
Sono certo che a te non capita mai.
 
Un avamposto qui vicino è stato attaccato da un gruppo di randellatori razziatori.
 
Da anziano del villaggio, ti consiglio di difendere l'avamposto e di mostrare ai cittadini della Grecia che non corrono pericoli a stabilirsi in nuove terre.

Non ho letto correttamente i geroglifici? Tu sei Coccodrillo, giusto?
 
Sei l'unica persona che possa realizzare il mio sogno: l'unificazione dell'Egitto.
 
Un avamposto qui vicino è caduto nelle mani di predoni badari che hanno rifiutato l'idea di unirsi a noi. Eliminali affinché il nostro popolo possa crescere e prosperare.

Ah, eccoti!
 
È un piacere vederti. Sotto il tuo comando uniremo le tribù e diventeremo una civiltà che farà invidia al mondo! 
 
Siamo forti e dobbiamo usare questa forza per proteggere coloro che non possono farlo da soli. Una tribù vicina sta subendo l'attacco dei barbari. 
 
Quei bruti privi di cultura distruggeranno tutto se li lasciamo fare. Vai a massacrarli tutti!

I barbari hanno passato il segno. Se i greci ci confondono con loro, l'unica soluzione è la completa distruzione di tutti i barbari. 
 
La cacciatrice di teste Etain ha localizzato il loro stanziamento e ha fondato un campo base appena fuori dalla loro portata. Una volta che raggiungi il campo, ti darà il comando delle cacciatrici di teste, degli arcieri con arco lungo, dei frombolieri e delle navi cigno. 
 
Per la gloria della civiltà celtica!
Sconfiggi i barbari con l'aiuto delle cacciatrici di teste di Etain, degli arcieri con arco lungo, dei frombolieri e delle navi cigno.
Acquisizione risorse
Sconfiggi la squadra avversaria in una partita PvP non classificata 2c2.
Acquisisci oro per gli artigiani.
Come va la spedizione di raccolta oro?
Un lavoro da maestro! Ai nostri artigiani farà piacere sapere che il loro oro grezzo è al sicuro.

Gli artigiani più abili cercano sempre materie prime per esercitare la propria arte. Purtroppo l'abilità di un artigiano raramente si presta alle attività belliche. Alcuni dei nostri maestri artigiani hanno un'esigenza di oro così costante da inviare regolarmente spedizioni per acquisirne altro. Naturalmente, dove c'è oro tende ad esserci anche gente senza scrupoli. I nostri artigiani temono che, senza una guida, i mercenari che hanno assoldato saranno incapaci di proteggere la spedizione. Sono disposti a separarsi da una parte dei loro oggetti migliori in cambio della tua protezione.
Fantastico! Sono ancora un ammiraglio e ho ancora la mia testa. \n \nParla con re Diomede per ottenere altro lavoro e fammi sapere se noti alcuni dei bagagli andati persi galleggiare.
Sono molto colpito. Ora che abbiamo recuperato i porti, i nostri alleati potranno sbarcare e potremo preparare il contrattacco.
Ops!
Sembra che qualcuno ti abbia chiesto di fare qualcosa che non occorre più fare! Parla con l'ambasciatore della tua città per sistemare questa faccenda.
Parla con l'ambasciatore della tua città\n

Clito controlla diversi accampamenti e non ti consiglio di attaccarlo. Fortunatamente, è una testa calda, facilmente irritabile. \n \nSe allestisci il tuo accampamento nel cuore delle sue terre, ti attaccherà. Se riesci a sopravvivere, sarà costretto ad attaccarti personalmente. Quello sarà il momento di colpire!
Ci sono troppi pirati! Cosa ancora peggiore, hanno troppe Trireme d'elite.\n \nPuoi aiutare? Non è ora di potare le triremi?
In tutto il mondo si possono trovare dei tesori, spesso sorvegliati da criminali senza scrupoli. \n \nTieni qualsiasi tesoro trovi. Basta che porti la prova di aver ucciso i guardiani.
Fammi controllare nell'archivio ufficiale delle richieste.\n \nCome sospettavo, questa missione non deve più essere completata. Eccoti delle monete per il tuo disturbo.

Grazie al tuo impegno i celti hanno l'oro che occorre per costruire il cerchio cerimoniale. I loro guai non sono finiti! 
 
Se vogliamo che la cerimonia avvenga in tempo, dobbiamo trovare il modo di procurarci i materiali che servono agli artigiani. 
 
Ci servono ancora una volta le tue abilità. Procurati più pietra che puoi. Attento: gli oxubi sono in zona.

C'è un buon motivo per cui i cinghiali sono sacri per noi celti. Sono potenti lottatori quando si affrontano e nessun banchetto è completo senza un cinghiale arrosto in tavola. 
 
A proposito di banchetti, mi è stata richiesta una montagna di cinghiali per il banchetto di celebrazione della tua vittoria. Sono certo che non ti dispiace darmi una mano, giusto? 
 
Se fornisci la metà dei cinghiali, ti pagherò per il disturbo.

Ave! Sono Acicorio, un veterano della campagna di Grecia precedente. Brenno mi ha detto che sull'acqua te la cavi bene quanto in terraferma. 
 
I greci sono irritati per la loro città e hanno radunato una difesa per impedirci di attraversare l'Evros. Non possiamo farci fermare da questo blocco! 
 
Prendi la nostra flotta, rafforzata dalla trireme con balista che abbiamo preso da Filippopili, ed elimina il blocco. Fai passare i nostri trasporti mercantili dall'Evros!

Quando assaltavano Massalia, gli oxubi hanno tenuto lontani i loro concorrenti. Ora che hai sconfitto gli oxubi, quei concorrenti bussano alle porte di Massalia! 
 
Credo che ad attaccare Massalia al momento sia il leggendario popolo del mare, il terrore delle città costiere. Se non lo sconfiggi in fretta, Massalia non conoscerà mai più la pace. 
 
Raduna le tue forze e difendi Massalia!

Quei vili dei traci non intendono lasciarci stare. Dobbiamo ricorrere a misure drastiche per mantenere il collegamento fra Tylis e la nazione Celtica. 
 
I traci hanno assoldato degli ateniesi per costruire potenti macchine da assedio. Se non distruggiamo i loro accampamenti d'assedio, perderemo la nostra nuova città. 
 
Temo che da questa missione non torni nessuno. Distruggi il campo d'assedio e muori sapendo che ci hai assicurato un futuro.

Il ponte che attraversa lo Spercheios è stato distrutto. Dobbiamo trovare il modo di ricostruirlo prima di andare oltre. 
 
Auggie l'augure ci ha onorati della sua presenza. È sicuro che possiamo convincere gli abitanti del villaggio greco a raccogliere il legname che ci occorre. 
 
Una volta che hai raccolto legname sufficiente, lo caricheranno su una carovana. Porta al sicuro la carovana e domattina avremo i ponti.

The Greek city of Delphi houses the wealthy Temple of Delphi. As our forefathers sacked Rome, so shall we sack Delphi! 
 
We have many great Celts, but we must bolster our forces every way that we can. We possess a Thracian town that will give us the manpower we need, but its neighbor wants to burn the town to stop us! 
 
I will go and rally these men to protect their town. Scout ahead and tell me what soldiers we will need!

It has been a long journey, but we are now at the end. Behold, the city of Delphi! 
 
Their priests are praying day and night for their gods to strike us down. Their warriors sleep with their spears, anticipating our attack at any moment. 
 
Nothing will save their treasure. Lead our armies, and take me to the steps of the Temple of Delphi!
Take Brennos to the Temple of Delphi.

My cousin leads another tribe not far from here, and his people live in squalor. They have no Storehouses to make gathering efficient, and without any Houses, they are packed like sardines in the Town Hall. \n \nYou will have to force his people into proper living. Clearcut the forest and build them an actual village!

There is an outpost not far from here that is a haven of indolence. Laziness. Dilly-dallying! They complain that resources are too far away, but all I hear are pitiful excuses for pushing back our schedule to unify Egypt. \n \nYou must show them the way! Build a Storehouse near the forest so the Villagers can easily gather Wood. After that, use the Wood to build Houses, which will increase the outpost's population and put their excuses to rest.
This Crafting Hall will be a shining jewel in the crown of Egypt!
Let's show these people the craftsmanship of the Celts!
Defend the ally Town Center. Move Brennos to the Barracks, Archery Range, and Stables to recruit units.

Word of your Crafting Hall has spread. Craftsmen from a small village nearby would like to come to your Capital City to work. Unfortunately, they have been captured by Bandits. \n \nGo rescue the Craftsmen and bring them back to your Town Center. Get a move on!
Lead Auggie the Augur to the base camp.
Let's show those Greeks who commands the waters!
Defeat the opposing team in a 2v2 Champion ranked PvP match.
Having a Pharaoh in your debt is no small matter.
Vizier's Remnants
Darius gave us a pile of silks in thanks to your efforts. Here is your cut!
Have you worn a silk toga? It feels marvelous.
The Council of Imhotep's strategy and research was no match for our economic might!
The locals are overjoyed with our aid. Our warehouses are being filled with their trade goods as we speak.
When someone has something important, they are willing to pay through the nose to defend it.
Minos will have to come up with a better plan than that if he wants to stump us. Here is your share of the profits.
I started up a gambling pool to further increase our profits from this venture.
Darius is truly a generous man! I cannot wait to sell these rewards. Here is your cut, of course.
I wonder what the reward is. Incense? Gold-plated incense?

I love the jingle of hard-won coin. Here is your cut of the prize money.
Money overcomes technology any day!
That is how we get paid! And this is you being paid right now for your hard work.

King Minos is an extravagant man. Sometimes he makes up contests to amuse himself. For his latest contest, we will be one of three teams vying for control of a well-defended Wonder. To do so, instead of using a base and Villagers, we must capture smaller camps to train an army. \n \nYou will represent us in this challenge. Capture the outlying camps, build a military, and gain control of the Wonder! Stop the competition to earn greater rewards.
Darius sends us his blessings and thanks. You have done well.
Is this reality?
You are a warrior with the know-how to deliver!
Many will challenge the Legion. All will learn humility.
You have delivered a clear defeat to the Delian League!
You will be victorious and honor will be ours!
The scribes prepare even now to write the history of your victory over the Delian League.
The Delian League's skills in battle were no match for the Legion!
The Delian League
The locals are overjoyed with our aid. We shall send emissaries to continue the goodwill and build a strong following in the region.
The locals are overjoyed with our aid. Recruitment will be sure to increase with so many clamoring to join our ranks.
Show them the might of the Legion!
Bring our ways to this new territory.
Minos will have to come up with better than that if he wants to stump us. Here is your reward.
Minos will have to come up with better than that if he wants to stump us. Here are rewards for your efforts.
Look beyond the doing and it will be done.
Beat them to a pulp.
Darius sends his praise with many gifts. You impress me yet again!
With each of your Persian victories, Darius grows as our ally. Well done.
Tomorrow is only possible when today is yesterday.
You must be planning something very cunning to still be talking to me.
Wisdom overcomes money any day!
Raw power and strategy overcomes technology any day!
Wisdom prevails again! Accept your reward.
This is a sweet victory for sure! Collect your spoils.

Prepare yourself! I have challenged the Delian League to a Palace race.\n \nWe will demonstrate our mastery of construction. You must finish our Palace before the Delian League completes their own. We are allowed to convert any Villagers we find to help build, and you can bet they will do the same.

Prepare for Battle! We have been challenged by the Council of Imhotep to a Palace race.\n \nThey are so sure of their efficient builders that they ignore our obvious military advantage. Prove them wrong by finishing our Palace before they complete their own. We are allowed to convert any Villagers we find to help build, and you can bet the Council of Imhotep will do the same.

King Minos has heard of our 'friendly' rivalry with the other alliances. He wants to help us resolve our differences once and for all, in the only way he knows how. Minos is hosting a Palace race right in his own backyard. The winner can expect a sizeable reward. \n \nMake sure King Minos knows our work is not free. Gather as many Villagers as you can and finish that Palace before the opposing alliance!

King Minos has heard of our efforts to pacify the Delian League. He believes he can help resolve the conflict by hosting a Palace race on his island nation of Crete. He offers a reward to the victor, but we do this for the opportunity to bring our ways to the people of his lands. The Cretians will soon know the Council is their ally! \n \nGather as many Villagers as you can and finish that Palace before the opposing alliance!

King Minos has heard of our 'friendly' rivalry with the other alliances. He wants to help us resolve our differences once and for all, in the only way he knows how. Minos is hosting a Palace race right in his own backyard. The winner can expect a sizeable reward. \n \nA victory is the only outcome you should prepare for. Gather as many Villagers as you can and finish that Palace before the opposing alliance!

We are not the only people who have recognized that Belgica is a land of untapped wealth. The other alliances are wise to our game. We must win the hearts of the people in order to win the wealth of the land. What better way to do that than to spend a large amount of money to create a Palace in their pristine fields? \n \nThe other alliances are going to try to beat us to the punch. Convert as many Villagers as you need to finish our Palace first.
The people of Crete need to know of the Council's vision for a peaceful future.
I once arm-wrestled King Minos. I let him win.
What news of you from Belgica?

We are not the only people who have recognized that Belgica is a land of hope. The other alliances are aware of our goal and seek to stop us. We must win the hearts of the people in order to maintain the high ground. I see a gleaming new Palace in the Belgica countryside bustling with the activity of our new allies. \n \nThe other alliances are going to try to outmatch us. Convert as many Villagers as you need to finish our Palace first.

We are not the only people who have recognized that Belgica is a land of warriors with promise. The other alliances are wise to our game. We must show the peoples of Belgica our strength by being the first to construct a monumental Palace in their heartland. \n \nThe other alliances are going to try to beat us to the punch. Convert as many Villagers as you need to finish our Palace first.
Belgica Ally
The Belgica Defense
A warrior alone in the woods does not fall!
Through faith we prevail! The Council is most pleased.
A grand strategy indeed! You continue to prove yourself a true champion of the Legion.
Wisdom has guided you to victory yet again! The Council praises your success.
Another stunning display of your tactical prowess! Claim your reward.

A Visitor! Welcome to Vanity Island, a land of all things amazing, exotic, and wild.
 
While you're here, you should look around and see all of the latest fashions and decorations. If you see anything you like, simply select the nearby store to make a purchase.
 
Oh, and before I forget, here is a welcoming gift!

Greetings! Welcome to Delos fine noble. Your arrival was eagerly awaited, but statistically inevitable.
 
The Delian League is in the business of making great partnerships with the leaders and peoples of the world. We do however limit our ranks to only a certain few who have demonstrated a balance of intellect and tactical prowess.
 
You fit the bill. Join us and together we will formulate our success!
The champion has arrived!\n \nThe Legion of Carthage is always looking for warriors. We keep it simple too: join us and the victories will be endless. Oppose us and you will be crushed.

The stars aligned, foretelling of your visit to our sacred lands.
 
I am Imhotep, leader of this council. From here in the Farafra Oasis we strive to bring about a new peace to all of the world. This is made possible by those strong of character, such as yourself.
 
Share in our vision and cure the world of its many ills.

The Celtic chieftain Brennos has revealed a new land to the north: Belgica. If it's anything like Gaul, it's a dark place in need of our wisdom. The Celts seem to fight anyone and everyone, including their own people. Some local villagers are concerned that their Sacred Groves are being targeted for a pincer attack. \n \nGo to Belgica and defend as many of the Sacred Groves as you can.

The Celtic chieftain Brennos has revealed a new land to the north: Belgica. If it's anything like Gaul, it's a wealth of powerful warriors. The Celts seem to fight anyone and everyone, including their own people. Some local villagers are concerned that their Sacred Groves are being targeted for a pincer attack. \n \nGo to Belgica and defend as many of the Sacred Groves as you can.

The Celtic chieftain Brennos has revealed a new land to the north: Belgica. If it's anything like Gaul, it's a wealth of natural resources. The Celts seem to fight anyone and everyone, including their own people. Some local villagers are concerned that their Sacred Groves are being targeted for a pincer attack. \n \nGo to Belgica and defend as many of the Sacred Groves as you can.

Sesostris is pleased with your aid, and the Delian League is gaining fame in Egypt. You deserve this.
Sesostris is pleased with your aid, and the Council of Imhotep is gaining loyal allies in Egypt. Accept this reward.
Sesostris is pleased with your aid, and the Legion of Carthage has gained honor. Enjoy these rewards.

Pharaoh Sesostris has issued a challenge to the Delian League and the Council of Imhotep. The winner of this contest will earn some amount of his favor, and we both know that favor equals coin. \n \nThere are eleven islands, each with a defended obelisk at the center. You must capture and hold a majority of the islands to win the contest. Smash those ships and control those islands! For glory and trade!
Sesostris will be so impressed with us when we win! Gold will shower upon us!

Pharaoh Sesostris has issued a challenge to the Delian League and the Council of Imhotep. The winner of this contest will earn his trust and allegiance. \n \nThere are eleven islands, each with a defended obelisk at the center. You must capture and hold a majority of the islands to win the contest. Be steadfast and give no ground to the Delian League. Stop their ships and control the islands. I see only your inevitable success!

Pharaoh Sesostris has issued a challenge to the Delian League and the Legion of Carthage. Those greedy traders care only for the spoils of the victory, but for us this is a matter of pride and honor. \n \nThere are eleven islands, each with a defended obelisk at the center. You must capture and hold a majority of the islands to win the contest. Smash those ships and control those islands! For glory and honor!

Pharaoh Sesostris rose to power just recently, but the Vizier's men are still fighting him across Egypt. His problem is our profit. The man needs help, and I want you to provide that help. The remnants of the Vizier's army are assaulting a group of villages in a narrow desert canyon. \n \nDefend the villages. The more you save, the more you will be compensated.

Pharaoh Sesostris rose to power just recently, but the Vizier's men are still fighting him across Egypt. In my dreams I see a strong alliance with the young Pharaoh, we clearly must come to his aid. The remnants of the Vizier's army are assaulting a group of villages in a narrow desert canyon. \n \nDefend the villages. The more you save, the more you will be compensated.

Pharaoh Sesostris rose to power just recently, but the Vizier's men are still fighting him across Egypt. This is an opportunity to demonstrate our skills, power, and honor. We must help the new Pharaoh. The remnants of the Vizier's army are assaulting a group of villages in a narrow desert canyon. \n \nDefend the villages. The more you save, the more you will be compensated.

Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nAn opportunity for new fashion and decorations is right around the corner. Travel to Vanity Island and speak to my dear friend Monty. He might even be persuaded to give you a few gifts.

Are you impressed?
 
I am the Heroic Trader, my goods are made of the finest materials by the most skilled of craftsmen. Flashy? Very.
 
Take your time looking around and here is a gift. Hope you enjoy!

They always save me for last! Am I the best? Yes!
 
My goods are certainly going to make you stand out. But like I always say, everyone needs a rainbow!
 
Take your time looking around and here is a gift. Hope you enjoy!
Monty mentioned you might be stopping by. I trade all things exotic. I love to try new things from far off lands.\n \nTake your time looking around and here is a gift. Hope you enjoy!
Since you are one of our first visitors, be sure and stop by the Exotic Trader, he has a gift for you as well.\n \nSmiles everyone, smiles!

Persia has so much to offer the Delian League: spices, silks, and even this thing called perfume. We need those goods to expand our trade empire, and the perfect opportunity has come to my attention. Greek mercenaries are moving toward Persia now to take advantage of the Persian villages in a watery valley. If you stop them, Darius will surely favor us. \n \nGo to Persia and defend the villages. The more that survive, the more you will be compensated.

An ominous haze clouds all of Persia since the advent of Darius and his new empire. As we speak, Greek mercenaries are marching toward undefended Persian villages in a watery valley. \n \nGo to Persia and defend the villages. The more that survive, the more your vigilance will be rewarded.

Persia has a new leader, Darius, and he is looking at a major task to maintain stability in such a vast region of the world. The rumor amongst the mercenaries is that a group of Greeks is marching toward undefended Persian villages in a watery valley. \n \nGo to Persia and defend the villages. The more that survive, the greater the honor, and the greater the reward.

Pack your bags! We have been challenged by the Council of Imhotep to a Palace race.\n \nThey are so sure of their efficient builders that they are willing to bet on it. If money is involved, you know that the Delian League is there to collect. Finish your Palace before the Council of Imhotep does. We are allowed to convert any Villagers we find to help build, and you can bet those Imhotep zealots will do the same.

Darius the Great has issued a challenge to all alliances. And we intend on accepting. This is a challenge of speed and cunning. Darius has identified several quarrelsome villages that have been resisting his rule. The objective is to capture all of them in time. \n \nYou will start with only a small military force. Capture the villages to increase your might, and choose your targets carefully! The faster you capture all villages, the greater our victory.

Darius the Great has issued a challenge to all alliances. A bold and enticing move in my opinion. This is a challenge of speed and cunning. Darius has identified several quarrelsome villages that have been resisting his rule. The objective is to capture all of them in time. \n \nYou will start with only a small military force. Capture the villages to increase your might, and choose your targets carefully! The faster you capture all villages, the greater the honor.

Darius the Great has issued a challenge to all alliances. Persian rewards are so exotic, I am sure we can turn around and sell it for at least triple. This is a challenge of speed and cunning. Darius has identified several quarrelsome villages that have been resisting his rule. The objective is to capture all of them in time. \n \nYou will start with only a small military force. Capture the villages to increase your might, and choose your targets carefully! The faster you capture all villages, the greater your rewards.
Fantasy Trader
You want one more gift? That can be arranged.\n \nVisit the Fantasy Trader, he has a final gift for you.
Speak to the Fantasy Trader to receive a gift.
Speak to the Fantasy Trader\n
Before I forget, be sure to also stop by the Heroic Trader, he also has a gift for you!
Heroic Trader
Speak to the Heroic Trader to receive a gift.
Speak to the Heroic Trader\n
Pro Babylonian Civilization
Meet the Babylonians

Median Manipulations
Night Raider
Delta Force
Den of Thieves
Alpine Escort
Clear The Way
Wonder Race
Temple Wrecker
Vindelicia Militia

Word of your Crafting Hall has spread. Craftsmen nearby would like to come to your Capital City to work, but they are held captive by some bandits. If we can rescue them and provide them an escort, they will greatly improve our economy.
Median Ally
Caravans Escorted
Lost Island of King Tusk
Raiders of Amasis
Levant Mercenaries
Sanctuary of Amytis
Natural Expansion

Bard Hall Reached In Time

Train Only Cavalry And Villagers

Train No Ranged

Train Only Cavalry and Villagers

Train No Swanships

Elite Catapult Trireme Killed
Train Only Spearmen And Villagers
Babylon is still in unrest!
The people of Babylon sing praises of your cunning and bravery.
Not only do we survive, we thrive on the defeat of our enemies!
Pirate Fleet Destroyed
The sweet smell of victory is best enjoyed in the shade of our new Hanging Gardens.
Our queen awaits the completion of her Hanging Gardens, and our enemies await the shadow of your sword on their necks.
Ally's Fortresses Must Survive

Your arrival in Babylon could not have been better timed!\n \nWould-be conquerors and usurpers are taking arms against Babylon, but now that we have a strong commander such as you, peace will surely follow.
Elites Killed In Time

After a hard march, Auggie reached the base camp. He was glad to be out of the cold. Inside the building was a pair of brothers also seeking shelter from the harsh mountain. 
 
The brothers shared their simple meal with Auggie, and the three resolved that they would cross the Alps together. Auggie's brains and the brothers' brawn would overcome all obstacles. 
 
When the sun rose once more, the three continued the journey. They had to reach the camp at the mountain's peak or all would be lost.
Empire Vault
Crushed Spirits Killed In Time
Thracian Horsemen
Enraged Boars
Trader
Mountain People
Temple Guardians
Tiny Umbrellas Collected
Fungal Growth Collected
Rare Spices Collected
Northern Dock Reached
Queen Bee's Honey Collected
Tears of Isis Collected
Sesame Seeds Collected
Collect Materials for Farzana.
Merodach Killed
Merodach's Lieutenants Killed
Tribute Food to summon King Tusk. Defeat him to collect the Fungal Growth.
Collect the Queen Bee's Honey. Reach the northern Dock.
Defeat the Temple Guardians. Collect the Tears of Isis.
Capture the Priests. Collect the Tiny Umbrellas.
Defeat the Parthian Rebels in the canyon. Protect the Town Center.
Escort the Caravans through the mountains. Collect the Rare Spices.
Clear the path into the den of the Thieves. Collect the Sesame Seeds.
Visit Babylon and Talk to Governor Zopyrus\n
Caravans Move Out In...
Den of Thieves Reached
Food Tributed to Summon King Tusk
King Tusk Killed
Way to lay down Hammurabi's Smack!
Caravans Destroyed
Northern Trade Depot Must Survive
Ally Town Freed
Gardens Recovered
Nikanuur killed
The sea. The sea never changes. So why haven't we figured out how to keep enemies from using it to invade us?
Travel to the capital of Babylon and speak with the Babylonian Trader.
Gather unto you a thousand spears, ten thousand arrows, and unhinge the machines of war!

Enemies of Babylon have taken the field! We do not yet know who is gathering these mercenaries together, but we do know that a strong show of force will weaken their resolve. Build a massive army to show them the futility of attacking Babylon.

Amytis is the wife of our revered leader Nebuchadnezzar. Their marriage sealed a peace between the two great nations of Babylon and Media. Yet the fair queen longs for the familiar sights and smells of her homeland, so Nebuchadnezzar has tasked you with building Hanging Gardens throughout Babylon.\n \nHowever, the enemies of Babylon see this as an opportunity to strike at the heart of our nation, and our queen. Build the wonder and show the enemies of Babylon we have nothing to fear from them.
Train Only Naval And Villagers
Boss Challenge
Babylon and the city of Eridu needs you!
Merchant Transports Destroyed
Zu's Town Center Must Survive
Golden Tickets Collected
Vanity Tickets Collected
Golden Ticket (Uncommon)
Golden Ticket (Rare)
Vanity Ticket
Travel to Vanity Island and give Monty a Vanity Ticket to receive a special reward.
Give Marcus Pollux a Golden Ticket to receive several Treasure Chests with Rare gear.
Give Marcus Pollux a Golden Ticket to receive several Treasure Chests with Uncommon gear.
Still no Golden Tickets?
Ah, a Golden Ticket! Please accept these Treasure Chests in exchange.
Just remember, if you track down a Vanity Ticket, I will gladly exchange it for a special reward.

As you travel and explore, you might come across a rare item called a Golden Ticket. They are very pretty and all the rage amongst the wealthy of the world. If you happen to find any, I will gladly trade several Treasure Chests for each.

The vanity traders have gotten together and organized a contest where everyone can be a winner!\n \nIf you want to participate, keep an eye out for an item called a Vanity Ticket. Bring me any you find and I will exchange them for a special reward.
Another winner!
Babylon Must Not Fall!
Median Raiders

The walls of this city will never be breached, but it will not matter if our lands continue to be raided and outposts continue to be attacked. Join Retired General Zu and Engineer Farzana and defeat these Median Raiders.
Farzana's Engineer Corp
Engineer Farzana
Retired General Zu
I knew that enlisting your help was a great idea! Please accept this reward for your efforts.

Your services are needed again.\n \nEngineer Farzana has a plan to deal with the Median Raiders and insists that your help is essential. Please, please, go speak with her. Her endless stream of ideas can be a bit much, but she has the city's best interests in mind.
Speak with Engineer Farzana about her plan to deal with the Median Raiders.
Speak With Engineer Farzana\n
Speak With Retired General Zu\n
Speak with Retired General Zu and convince him to tell you his plans for the territory of Susa.
A Median Alliance?
Median Mayhem
Mad Maneuverings
We originally thought about developing portable siege tunnels, but everyone seems to think that digging their own is more efficient. I still think it might work.

A messenger reports that the Medians dance with joy to have their hands on our Siege Towers! Great work!\n \nPlease let Governor Zopyrus know that a new Median alliance has begun! You should probably tell the Port Master too, but she seems to be in a stormy mood.
Since the times of Cyrus, many dangerous men have come from the lands of Media. Makru is not the first, nor will he be the last.
I am thankful you managed to repair the situation! Now we must act fast to block this Mad Median from recovering.
Destroy Makru's supply center so that we may gouge evil from its shell!
Cut the head off the snake, and the body dies, eh?\n \nAn urgent report has just come in from the Median border, so please excuse me a moment.

Makru is vulnerable if we stop his supply lines. Fortunately, we have learned the exact location of his supply center. Many of our best scouts died to bring me this information.\n \nYou will approach the supply center by water. Quickly setup your own base and attack!
General Zu, What Did You Do?
Return to Media to defeat Makru, the Mad Median once and for all. Do not allow Retired General Zu's Town Center to be destroyed.
My apologies for earlier. General Zu always makes me bare my claws. He's an old ox!\n \nNow, let me tell you this most brilliant idea I have for dealing with the Median Raiders.
Quickly setup your own base, then destroy the enemy Town Center to cut off Makru's supply lines.
Maybe meditation would help me handle this headache. I could get Retired General Zu to show me... Oh, that's right: he's out fighting the Mad Median.
General Zu's Loyalists
Return to the Diyala Valley in Media and destroy the Mad Median's Siege Workshops and Town Center.

This is bad. Retired General Zu has rushed ahead to fight alone against Makru, the Mad Median. While truly bold, he is outmatched and his senility has gotten the best of him. He refuses help from my scouts and is attacking them on sight.\n \nNot only must you return to Media to defeat Makru, you also need to protect Retired General Zu's forces as best you can. They will attack you, but you must avoid attacking back. General Zu is too important to the stability of Babylon.
Excellent work! General Zu is safe and with any luck, Media will remain stable from now on.\n \nWhich is good, because already new troubles have begun.

Despite your earlier rescue, Retired General Zu is at it again.
 
He learned of a new Median warlord and immediately rushed off. Just like before, he refuses help from my scouts and is attacking them on sight.
 
Not only must you return to Media to defeat this new warlord, you need to protect Retired General Zu's forces as best you can. They will attack you, but you must avoid attacking back.
Return to Media to defeat the new Median warlord. Do not allow Retired General Zu's Town Center to be destroyed.
And again, Babylon is in your debt! I'll try and keep a better watch on General Zu from now on.
I am fairly certain General Zu is aware that he is actually retired, but good luck getting him to admit it.
Makru, the Mad Median
Babylon used to be a great city, ruled by Nebuchadnezzar.\n \nLife as part of the Persian Empire? Meh.
Use the troops provided by Retired General Zu to escort your Villagers and defend them while they build Fortresses at the marked locations.

Do I know you? You must be the new recruit. Now listen up! I'm not going to repeat myself.\n \nThe mission is to secure Susa, and I know just the way to do it. And just so we're clear, this is for your ears only recruit. Governor Zopyrus better not hear a word of it.
I got my eyes on you recruit. My eyes. On you.

You did good work recruit. With the Fortresses in place, we can begin enlisting the locals to be our canal diggers and to prepare the build site for the Wonder.\n \nPhase two of this operation is ready to commence.

The Wonder is complete! I am sure we will soon be receiving praise from the Susa locals. They must be extremely happy to now have such an impressive Babylonian monument right in the middle of their territory. You did good recruit. You did good.
I Wonder Why They Are Attacking?

The Babylonian merchant city of Eridu is under attack by the bandit commander Nikanuur. The city is home to our most prized Gardens, all of which have been captured by the cowardly marauder.\n \nTravel to Eridu to save the city and Gardens from Nikanuur!
The people of Eridu celebrate in the streets. Men want to serve in your army, and women wish their sons and daughters to grow strong like you.
I don't care for Persian music. I'll take that Oud time music any day!
The Wonder stands. Well done recruit.

The Wonder we built in Susa is under attack, again!\n \nThe Susa locals just don't appreciate the majesty of Babylon. You'll just have to convince them the hard way. Hold off the Susa attacks for as long as it takes. The Wonder must not fall.
And again, the Wonder stands! Excellent work.
I met Darius once, during the Egyptian campaign, when he was only a spearman. I didn't like him then either.
Return to Susa

Do you like Catapults?
 
They really are the perfect weapon. Thanks to Engineer Farzana, I have several modified versions of these fine machines ready to be tested. Just don't let her know I borrowed them!
 
You can test them out in Susa. There is a valley filled with Old Temples that should be fun to destroy. You can even try to wreck the locals' houses, if you feel like being mean. Ha! Just be careful not to upset too many of them at once, they can get pretty angry.
Use the modified Catapults provided by Retired General Zu to destroy the Old Temples. If you are feeling mean, destroy Houses as well. Be careful not to anger too many of the locals.
Was I right? Fine Catapults indeed!
I've seen a lot of buildings made out of mud bricks in my time, but some of these Old Temples are the worst.
Gold Tributed to Zu

The plan is to provide the Medians with a way to solve the raider problem themselves.\n \nI have already contacted an eager Median leader who will help us build this alliance. I just need you to safely escort the new Siege Towers from my workshops to his outpost in the Diyala Valley. Keep your eyes out for General Zu, he might try and stop us. He seems to think this is a bad idea. What a curmudgeon!
Escort the Siege Towers to the Median ally in the Diyala Valley.
Raiders of the Mad Median
Median Town Centers Destroyed
Summer Grab Bag
Collect Your Grab Bag from Marcus Pollux\n
Collect Your Grab Bag from Marcus Pollux.
Your Grab Bag has arrived!\n \nPlease enjoy your new supplies.
Welcome to Babylon, the jewel of the Euphrates river! Your arrival is much appreciated! There is much to be done if we are to ensure civil order in the city.

The legendary city of Babylon may soon topple without your help!\n \nRebellious neighbors threaten to capture the city. Babylon's Governor Zopyrus has asked for you specifically. What an excellent opportunity to help the people of Babylon.
Stone Tributed to Farzana
I'm a huge fan of Hammurabi, don't you know! He was a leader for the ages! Check out this sculpture of him that I'm making out of clay to accompany his tablets! A masterwork, no?
Raiders of the Lost Market
Hey, good job on saving the River Merchants' Market!
River Merchants' Market Must Survive
River Merchants
Kill the Marauder Captains.
Marauder Captains Killed
You are indeed the long arm of the law, my friend! If Hammurabi were still around, he would say that you did his Code proud!
The Marauders Strike Back
Red Dawn
An Eye for an Eye
Build No Guard Towers
Build And Train Nothing
Main Base Rescued
Don't you just love a good siege? With that over, I don't have to stay up nights worrying about those Rebellious Landholders anymore.
Rescue our Outpost and Age Up. Defeat Merodach and his Lieutenants. Smash his rebellion.

Babylon is being torn asunder by petty lords and civil unrest.\n \nThe worst is the would-be king Merodach. His every word is drenched in lies, and his smiles hide daggers. He has hired Egyptian Mercenaries to invade our lands, and is forcing the common people to bend a knee to his will. You will be our sword to cut through his web of lies.
Rebellious Landholders
Free the Parthian Ally villages to earn their help. Protect the Northern Trade Depot by defeating the Rebellious Landholders.
White Temple of Uruk Must Survive
Free the Parthian Ally town and defend it. Defeat the Rebellious Landholders.
Canyon Villages Captured
Valley Villages Captured
Parthian Capital Freed
Capital Town Center Must Survive
The Ambrosia Project
Island Natives
Island Natives Must Survive
Ambrosia Obsession
Ally Town Centers Must Survive

The first order of business is to deal with the Median Raiders attacking our outpost.\n \nWe don't know who is sending them, but our civil leaders, Retired General Zu and Engineer Farzana have sent forces to investigate. Unfortunately, they refuse to get along with each other, and are likely to die unless you help them with resources. Aid them with resources, and administer a crushing blow to these Raiders!
Raiders Defeated
Siege Towers Escorted In Time

I am hearing rumors of a plan to bring order to the neighboring territory of Susa by none other than Retired General Zu.\n \nUnfortunately, he is refusing to speak to me, and actually tried to throw a helmet at me when I approached him. Speak to him, learn his plan, and see what you can do to help.

Alright recruit, the plan is simple, we are going to bring discipline and a sense of purpose to the people of Susa, we are going to build a monument to the majesty of Babylon, a Wonder. Phase one of this operation is to clear the way.\n \nTravel to Susa with the small compliment of troops I will provide you, build Fortresses at the marked locations, and do not let any of the local rabble-rousers get in your way. Move out!

It's time to build the monument, a Babylonian Wonder, right where we know the people of Susa will be in awe. And it looks to be a race!\n \nAfter you returned from phase one, I had our people enlist the locals to dig canals at the build site. This did not sit well with some of the people of Susa. You will need to defend from their attacks as you complete construction of the Wonder. Use your priests to convert as many of the locals as you need. They might not like it now, but when this thing is finished they will be happy!
Complete construction of the Babylonian Wonder, the Hanging Gardens. Use your priests to convert local villagers to assist you. Prepare for attacks.

Word from Susa is not what we expected. A rebellion is brewing, and attacks are imminent.\n \nReturn to Susa and lead the defense. Use your Priests and any other forces you can muster to repel the attacking forces. We must defend our Wonder, now and for always! Failure is not an option!
Defend the Babylonian Wonder, the Hanging Gardens.
Forces of the Median Warlord
Susa Locals
Angry Susa Locals
Susa Canal Diggers
Disgruntled Gold Speculators
Use your Villagers and the Babylonian Ox Cart to accumulate Gold.
I've calculated a way to measure time using sexagesimal numbers. Be impressed.
Use your Villagers and the Babylonian Ox Cart to accumulate Gold. Destroy Caravans controlled by the Disgruntled Gold Speculators for additional Gold.
Wow, I'm tired after all of the traveling that I've been doing! It's time to take some scrolls outside and curl up.
I've actually lost count of how much Gold is still needed for the project, but you seem to be having so much fun, I figured you would want to keep at it.
By using simple piece of wood and fabric, I believe I can construct a portable boat that also doubles as a sun hat. I'll be sure to offer you the first one!
This should be enough Gold to make significant progress in the project.
Oh, I can definitely see uses for all of this Gold along with funding my big project! I'm going to have to make a list, or two...
An impressive accomplishment! So much Gold, and all for Science! Well mostly.
Ok, that's probably enough Gold for now.

Thanks again for your help in Media, but now I need Gold for another project.\n \nThe rainy season is over, and Gold is plentiful along the banks of the rivers. There's a place along the Tigris that's teeming with Gold. Lead a Babylonian Ox Cart around and use your Villagers to gather Gold into it. Get lots!

Ok we need more Gold. Thankfully, there's still plenty along the Tigris. Unfortunately, others are moving in.\n \nGold Speculators have been spotted and would love to find your Ox Cart laden with Gold. Get the Gold while you can, but don't stay at one deposit too long!

My projections estimate, more Gold will be needed. But the Disgruntled Gold Speculators are getting tough!\n \nWe've seen them patrolling deposits while waiting for their gatherers. But their Caravans keep getting stuck in the mud! As a way to speed up the Gold collecting, go for their Caravans, I bet each will give you a nice boost of Gold.

At this point, let's just get more of the Gold while the Gold getting is still so good!\n \nBut beware, Disgruntled Gold Speculators are everywhere! Collect what Gold you can and look for more opportunities to take it from them.
The Parthian Alliance

Time heals all wounds, and it will take time with the landholders. The good news is that you saved the Northern Trade Depot, and our ally is pleased!\n \nRegretfully, there are still troublemakers to deal with.
Well, that had to hurt! We won't be hearing from those landholders anytime soon!\n \nTime will tell if this squelches the rebellions.

We certainly kicked the hornets' nest in Parthia!\n \nInsulted that you've beaten them, landholders are marching on the Parthian capital. Many of the empire's Siege Workshops are there, and we need them to crush the enemy. Thus it is imperative that we free the city and use the siege weapons to destroy the Rebellious Landholders.
With so much turmoil in Parthia, I shall not be able to visit anytime soon. I hear their archery competitions are quite exciting.
Give me your honest opinion. Does this tunic look "stately" enough? I want people to recognize me as their governor, not a fish merchant.
It is a pity that my job requires so much of my attention. I wonder if my children even remember my name?
This job adds another worry-wrinkle to my brow every year. My wife says it makes me look distinguished. I think it makes me look old.
Parthian Rebels
Free the Parthian capital and defend it. Defeat the Rebellious Landholders.

With Makru defeated, we must now turn our attention to Parthia.\n \nA group of wealthy landholders have taken up arms and a loyal Parthian Ally requests assistance in quelling this rebellion. The landholders are operating out of a base that threatens our ally's Northern Trade Depot. The villages surrounding this base will aid us once they have been freed of landholder forces. Crush this rebellion before the Depot is lost.

Even after your pounding, Rebellious Landholders are threatening the Parthian capital again!\n \nPerhaps you went too easy on them last time? Free and protect the Parthian Capital! Make the Rebellious Landholders regret this!
Excellent! You have once again pulverized the Rebellious Landholders and saved me from another headache!
Canyon Clearing
Woah, what a relief! Thanks for your help in clearing the canyon.
Landholder Lunacy
Kicking The Hornets' Nest
The Landholder Nuisance

Here we go again! A group of particularly stubborn landholders is causing trouble for our Parthian Ally.\n \nAssist our ally by clearing the Rebellious Landholders from the small town near their base. Then, with the assistance of our ally, crush the attacker where it hurts the most: their hometown!

Parthian Rebels occasionally blockade the canyon near our ally's Trading Post.\n \nThis is to convince us to leave Parthia. With the canyon blocked, trade caravans halt. Trounce those Parthian Rebels! The ally's Town Center must not fall!
Time Challenge Two
Time Challenge One
Parthian Capital
Coastal Townsfolk
Coastal Towns Freed

Marauders from the Persian Gulf are heading upriver.
 
A village of River Merchants is in their sights. It serves as a gateway to much of our commerce in the Tigris-Euphrates delta. The Marauders are threatening to destroy it.
 
I need you to protect the Market in the River Merchants' village! Marauders are tough too, so you had better get a friend!
Marauders, Marauders, Marauders! That's all I hear about all day! Why don't they plunder elsewhere? I mean, the pickings here are easy enough, but where's the challenge?
Protect the River Merchants' Market from Marauders.

The Marauders are pushing inland! We have to take the fight to them. Under the cover of night, assault their base, then find and kill the Marauder Captains. "An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth," said Hammurabi.\n \nOh, and don't forget a friend.

The Marauders are truly relentless! They're on the move again.
 
Their target this time will likely be the White Temple of Uruk. The temple is essential to Uruk's political power, and if it falls, chaos will ensue. Protect the White Temple of Uruk to retain the city's hold on the Delta!
 
You'll need help yet again.
People of Uruk
I bet those Marauders did not enjoy wading through your defenses like they had enjoyed wading ashore!
Protect the White Temple of Uruk against the Marauders.
Got any clams? I don't. Probably because you haven't been helping the people of Uruk where all the clams come from. Perhaps you should go there now!
Bringing down the law! The Hammurabi's law!

We live in a land of plenty, but sometimes that comes with a steep cost. If we pay it with Marauder lives, we'll hopefully break even if we lose less of our own in the process. We must adhere to Hammurabi's budget!
Not only did the Marauders feel Hammurabi's fist, but I think that you gave them a taste of his boot as well!
When I'm feeling down, reading Hammurabi's code puts me back on my feet again! I should write a sequel.

Marauders are attacking the River Merchants... again!
 
You must show the Marauders that, no matter how many times they try, we're always going to defeat them. Always.
 
And be sure to bring a friend, they might be better prepared this time.

The Marauders are seemingly not afraid of us still.\n \nRaid their base once more, but this time at daybreak. Kill the Marauder Captains. Make them rue coming to our waters. And in case you forget, you will really want to consider bringing a friend along.

Persian Marauders are back and looking to destroy the White Temple of Uruk.
 
You know what Hammurabi would do here, right? It's time for you and a friend to show them his fist to go along with his code!
 
Protect the White Temple of Uruk from the Marauders.

My colleagues and I have begun work on a secret project, a legendary Elixir with staggering potential. We have discovered the ingredients for it are scattered across distant lands.\n \nWe need you to travel to these places and gather up these ingredients for us. Hey! It sounds kind of like a scavenger hunt, doesn't it!
I think I have developed a more efficient way to watch paint dry. Would you like to be my first test volunteer?

You found the island? The people there worshipped a giant boar who was guarding the Fungal Growth? Sounds like a book I read the other day.\n \n Anyways, this Fungal Growth has some amazing properties. I bet the boar got so big because he was eating this stuff!
I do believe that Fungal Growth has some fantastic research potential. If you can't find any, may I suggest looking between Zu's toes?

Seventeen slippery scoundrels situated somewhere south stole some Sesame Seeds at sunset.\n \nWhew! Try and say that fast five times! One of our merchants had some Sesame Seeds that we need for the Elixir taken from him by a group of thieves. He tracked the thieves to their canyon hideout, which is blocked by stones. Tunnel your way in and get those Sesame Seeds back!
Once I add these Sesame Seeds to the Elixir, the entire universe shall be revealed to me! But first, let me heat them up a bit. The taste will be divine!
Once I have the Sesame Seeds, I have an experiment planned to combine them with a loaf of the baker's bread. I shall call it Farzana's Sesame Seed Bun of Wondrous Dimensions.
People of the Loom
I have a theory that Tiny Umbrellas could be used to protect you from getting soaked in the rain. Well, they would have to be a bit bigger I suppose...

Far across the ocean live the People of the Loom, master weavers who specialize in making Tiny Umbrellas with their diminutive hands. These umbrellas would be a nice finishing touch for the Elixir.\n \nCollect the Tiny Umbrellas from the temples. Be wary of their defenders, the Priests of the Loom. I can't believe I just said that out loud.

What? You think all the danger you faced just to get these Tiny Umbrellas was an unnecessary risk? I assure you, it may be the most important ingredient for the Elixir. You may have just guaranteed this drink will be supernaturally delicious!
Priest of the Loom Captured
I have been searching for a Frictional Repulsonic Inclination Semisonic Binding Elevation Extender for years now. I wonder if the fabled Trader has one?
The Last Cascade

Far to the North, near the edge of the world, barbarian tribes keep bees that make the best Honey, a vital ingredient for the Elixir.\n \nWaterfalls dot the river you will be traveling on, so you will have to trek inland at times to gather up the Queen Bee's Honey. Avoid the Barbarian Bee Keepers if you can!
This is honey fit for the gods themselves. One drop is as filling as a king's banquet. It may help if you ate a bit yourself to put some meat back on those bones! You nearly starved on the trip!
Queen Bee's Honey would make a fantastic adhesive agent. I think I will test my theory using it between two pieces of bread?
Barbarian Bee Keepers

I have to admit, I got a little misty-eyed when I heard you had returned with the Tears of Isis. Unbelievable that they actually do exist! With these, we are now one step closer to finishing the elixir. I wonder what could make a god cry?
I would hate to have been the one to ask Isis for her tears. Of course, if they had a practical scientific use, I might have been persuaded to tell her a sad story or two.
Temple Guardians Defeated
Don't Cry for me Farzana

The reaction to the Ambrosia has been so positive that my colleagues and I have decided to mass produce it and sell it to the public!\n \nWhat this means is that we would like you to get out there and collect all the ingredients for us again! Hey, why are you looking at me like that?

Once again, you don't disappoint! With all these ingredients you have gathered, we have enough to begin production on Ambrosia right away. I had an idea of opening my very own stall in the marketplace to sell it to the public. I was thinking of calling it "FarzanaMart." What do you think?
You sure do look tired! I could give you some Ambrosia to perk you right up, but I seem to be all out. That's why we need you to gather the ingredients!

One of the ingredients we need for the Elixir is Fungal Growth. Eww, that sounds gross!\n \nDespite the fact that I don't relish the thought of drinking something containing Fungal Growth, we still need it. I did some digging in some ancient texts and found mention of a far-off island where it is said to grow. It's not much to go on, but we need you to find the island and do what you must to obtain the Fungal Growth.

Legend has it that there is a hidden Temple of Isis near the ancient city of Sebennytos. In this temple is supposedly a vial of her tears, which we happen to need for the Elixir.\n \nThe temple is likely to be heavily guarded, if it exists at all. If you find it, defeat these guardians and bring me the Tears of Isis.
Nikanuur's Bandits
Eridu Ally
Pirate Fleet
Rebellious Medians
That's how a general gets the job done!
I'm tired of all these talks with Governor Zopyrus. I was a general, not a diplomat!
Median Village
Celebration Grab Bag
Player Victory Points
Enemy Victory Points
Travel to the city of Tarsos, in Mesopotamia, and speak with the Tarsos Trader.

Welcome to Tarsos, the commercial hub of western Mesopotamia! You could not have arrived at a more crucial time. With you here now, we might be able to rally against the terrible forces that threaten the whole of the Persian empire.

News from the East!
 
The city of Tarsos, a crucial trade port in the lands of Mesopotamia, has sent word that they are seeking the aid of fine war captains. They speak of a threat to Persia and a conflict over who should be the new leader after the death of Cyrus the Great.
 
If you feel up for an adventure, travel to Tarsos and offer to help the Tarsos Trader.
Visit the city of Tarsos, in Mesopotamia, and Speak to the Tarsos Trader\n

What was Farzana thinking? She didn't make an alliance in Media, and she had you deliver those Siege Towers directly to our enemy, Makru, the Mad Median!\n \nNot only is he the one behind the attacks on our outposts, but he is also trying to raise an army to conquer Babylon and all of Mesopotamia. You need to intervene right away. Use the troops provided by Farzana and your own forces to destroy Makru's Siege Workshops and outpost.
These Rare Spices are incredible! I have never seen or tasted anything like them--far better than caraway or cassia! I wonder how these would taste in my Marduk marshmallow cookie recipe.

A rebellion is brewing in Media, and Governor Zopyrus sits back and does nothing. Median villages are openly assisting rebels with troops and resources. Sure, it's not a problem in our backyard, but when I was Nebuchadnezzar's top general, this would have never been allowed.\n \nTravel to Media and deal with this problem. Take control of the villages yourself, and put an end to any hopes of a Median Rebellion. Be quick about it!

There is a Trader who is rumored to live in the mountains along the spice route to the northwest. The tales say he deals in Rare Spices, just what we need for the Elixir.\n \nYou are to escort our Caravans there and trade with him for the Rare Spices. Beware of the Mountain People! They would love nothing more than removing your head from your shoulders!

Celtic craftsmen have spent centuries perfecting the art of turning iron and gold into works of art. If we leverage their skills, we will no longer be dependent on whatever gear we can scavenge. \n \nTo begin, you must first build a Crafting Hall. After that, you can select the Crafting Schools for our people. Once you have selected your school, you can create gear and items for your troops, or you can trade them with neighboring cities.

Ambrosia! Nectar of the gods! That is what we will call the Elixir!\n \nAhhh... it tastes delicious! I feel as if the weight of the world has been lifted off my shoulders! It's only because of your hard work that this was even possible. My colleagues and I want you to take this reward for all you have done. You deserve it!
These Rare Spices are incredible! I have never seen or tasted anything like them--far better than cassia or caraway! I wonder how these would taste in my Marduk marshmallow cookie recipe.
Challenge: The Bronze Age
Challenge: The Silver Age
Challenge: Grab That Gold!
Challenge: Collect That Coin!
Challenge: Mine That Money!
Challenge: Hoard That Hoard!

Once more, your friend's ally is under attack!\n \nThe invaders are attacking already, and more are coming. Help them! A defense force has been assembled for you. As before, it may be units new to you, but I'm sure that you can handle it. Clear the city, followed by repelling the invading reinforcements.
Neighbor Favor
Construct No Defensive Structures
Legendary: Impossible Cataclysm
All of these uprisings will be the death of me. I think I'm developing an ulcer!
Use your Villagers and the Babylonian Ox Cart to accumulate Gold. Avoid taking too many losses from any Disgruntled Gold Speculators in the area.
Train Only Town Center Units

Greetings, traveler!\n \nGovernor Zopyrus in the city of Babylon seeks your aid! Speak to the City Ambassador and your voyage can commence.
Complete this quest, and then talk to the City Ambassador when you are ready to start playing The Fertile Crescent.\n \nThis booster is designed for level 20 players and above.
Travel to Babylon, a city in Mesopotamia, and speak with Governor Zopyrus.\n \nThis quest is part of the Fertile Crescent Booster which is designed for level 20 players and above.

Tribute resources to Retired General Zu and Engineer Farzana and to secure their assistance. Then defeat the Median Raiders with their help.\n \nThis quest is part of the Fertile Crescent Booster which is designed for level 20 players and above.

Messengers from the East!
 
The nation of Babylon is a center of culture and innovation, but turmoil and rebellion have sprung up across their lands. They need great commanders such as yourself to restore order.
 
Talk to the Babylonian Trader in the city of Babylon to help.
Visit the City of Babylon and Speak to the Babylon Trader\n
Speak with Governor Zopyrus.\n \nThis quest is part of the Fertile Crescent Booster which is designed for level 20 players and above.
Speak to Governor Zopyrus\n
While you are here, Governor Zopyrus probably has a few things for you to do as well. Be sure to speak to him and see if you can help.
Helping Babylon
While you are here, Chief Vemundr could certainly use your assistance. Be sure to speak to him before you leave.
Welcome to the Northern Hold! The last bastion of freedom this side of the war.\n \nIf a fight is what you are looking for, you are certainly in the right place.
Speak with Chief Vemundr.\n \nThis quest is part of the Northern Invasion Booster which is designed for level 20 players and above.
Helping Chief Vemundr
Speak to Chief Vemundr\n
Travel to the Northern Hold, an outpost in Northern Europe, and speak with Chief Vemundr.\n \nThis quest is part of the Northern Invasion Booster which is designed for level 20 players and above.
Unrest in the North

Unrest in the north has turned to war. A powerful Norse war leader is razing villages and towns alike.\n \nFortunately, freedom fighters have formed an outpost--but they are in desperate need of assistance. If you are up for the challenge, travel to this outpost, the Northern Hold, and speak to their leader, Chief Vemundr.
Visit the Northern Hold and Talk to Chief Vemundr\n
Meet The Norse
The Kraken's Grasp

Malcontents

Build a Barracks with your starting infantry units, and rescue the outpost. Then expand your army and destroy the enemy Town Centers.
Travel to the Northern Hold and speak with the Port Master.
Visit the Northern Hold and Speak to the Port Master\n

Use the Norse forces provided to cross the sea and destroy the enemy Fortresses.\n \nEnjoy this quest as a sample of what's available in the Pro Norse Civilization. For the full Norse experience, visit the Empire Bazaar and purchase the pack.
On Course, Heading Norse! (DEMO)
Challenge: The Golden Age
As quickly as possible, upgrade your Town Center to Age IV, the Golden Age.
As quickly as possible, upgrade your Town Center to Age III, the Silver Age.
As quickly as possible, upgrade your Town Center to Age II, the Bronze Age.
Legendary: Rescue Me
Legendary: I Know I'm Losing You
Legendary: Breaking Bandits

With their navy sitting on the bottom of the sea, the time has come to end this destructive conflict. \n \nOne island now stands between us and total victory. Crush their stronghold there and end this war once and for all.
Crush the Sea People. See them scattered before you. Hear their cries of despair!
Destroy the last stronghold of the Sea People and end the war.

The gods will sing your praises for this great victory! \n \nThe Sea People are scattered and leaderless now. I, and the people of Argos owe you a debt we can never repay. You will always be welcome here!

I have received word from my people. They have requested aid in securing their new settlement. \n \nI would ask you to protect them. Please stop the Sea People from destroying yet another place my people wish to call home.
Blessings upon you, friend. My people are safe because of you. They sleep in peace knowing their land is free of strife.
My people request your aid in securing their new home.
Defend the Town Center at all costs, defeating the Sea People in the process.
Two finer commanders I have not seen! You two have managed to do what no one else could do by defeating Clearchus. I salute you!
You have drawn out Clearchus himself into open battle. Can you finish what you started?
Along with your co-op partner, defeat all enemies on the map.

Do you want the good news or bad news first? \n \nThe good news is if you can survive this attack, there won't be another, potentially larger one. The bad news is Clearchus is out there, and all of his remaining troops are with him.

We must find all of the Followers of Autolycus and eradicate them, or they will keep coming back like the insects that they are. \n \nI want you to find every last one of them and crush them beneath your heel.
Good work. I don't think we will be seeing any of them ever again.
Show no mercy towards the enemy, for they will show you none.
Wipe the Followers of Autolycus from the face of the map.
Ha ha! That will teach those Celts not to cross into our lands! It seems our faith was well placed in you. Fine work!
I wonder what could have the Celts so worked up to make them flee so far north?

Har! *Burp* Have I got a doozy for you! \n \nA group of Celtic Wanderers are threatening one of our border outposts. I need you to get in there, defend the outpost, then take the fight back to those stinking Celts! Wipe them out!
The glory of battle! I wish I had been there to help! You did a good job though--not as good as I would have, but good enough!
Leave it to the Celts to be dumb enough to dare threaten us! Something must of really spooked them down south!
They called me crazy! "Build a boat on land, will you? Might as well make a ship that grows legs and jumps around!" Bah! You showed them!
We could build a statue of a giant bunny and the Celts would still cower in fear at our might. A ship will do just fine.

I need you to build me an army worthy of the Norse! \n \n*Burp* I should warn you, there are a couple of "puppies" who have taken it upon themselves to squabble over the scraps from my table. Shoo away their attacks while you train the army.
That will teach them to stick their noses in my business! I should award you with the title of "Dog Catcher!"
Bah! I can hear their incessant yelping even from here!
Outstanding! I thought for sure you would fail! Excellent work!
The reward for hard work is more hard work!

Alright! This one will definitely get the best of you! \n \nWhat? You think you can prove me wrong again? Then do it! Get out there, and as quickly as possible, upgrade your Town Center to Age III, the Silver Age.
Again, you surprise me! Me! I don't like surprises. Good work, anyways.
No pressure. The price of failure means a cold, lonely death. What? Fine, it means I'll yell at you a lot.

This is it! \n \nIn the name of Zeus's boot you will fail this time! Not even Apollo himself could do this! But go ahead and try if you must. As quickly as possible, I want you to upgrade your Town Center to Age IV, the Golden Age.
In all my years I have never seen this! You have done the impossible. The gods themselves have blessed you. I salute you, my friend.
I may as well have asked you to go bring me the head of Medusa, or find the Golden Fleece!

So you think you have what it takes to succeed where others have failed? \n \nPersonally, I don't think you have it in you! Prove me wrong! As quickly as possible, I want you to upgrade your Town Center to Age II, the Bronze Age.
Nearby Fortress Destroyed In Time

Argos Colonist Town Center Must Survive
Confront War Leader Beorix along the Greek coast and defeat his forces once and for all.
Assist the Argos Colonists who are being threatened by the Lackeys of Beorix.
Save the outpost of Tylis from the Lackeys of Beorix.
Make your way through entrenched enemy territory to the Dacian Outpost.
Dacian Outpost
Dacian Outpost Reached
Occupied Dacians
By freeing these villages, you've helped the people find their strength and courage again!

Beorix is continuing his march south. \n \nNow the outpost at Tylis is under threat from his Lackeys. Once again, it is up to you to get down there and stop them dead in their tracks. Send a strong message that wherever he and his forces strike, you will be there to stop him!
Again you have shown Beorix his attempt to conquer the world will do nothing but fail. Excellent work, my friend.
Repel the Lackey attacks and ensure the survival of the outpost.
Make sure that those docks are destroyed. If Beorix wants his Lackeys in Greece? Make them swim.
Destroy the Docks being used by the Lackeys of Beorix to send troops south to Greece.
Use your forces wisely and make sure Beorix is not successful.

That fool Vemundr fell for my trick at the docks, allowing me to launch a surprise attack on Crete. I always did want my own island. Muhahaha! \n \nNow, I want you to take the Lackeys and capture the city. If Vemundr or any of his idiot generals show up, make sure to give them a proper welcome.
Once again, Vemundr and his whelps do too little, too late. When will he learn to quit bringing a dagger to a catapult fight?
Press the attack until the city is taken.
Keep the pressure on! Drive the enemy out of the city.
I love the smell of burning Lackey fortresses in the morning. Smells like... victory.
Protect the Town Center at all costs. It must not fall!

It was only a matter of time. \n \nLackeys of Beorix have landed close to the Greek mainland and are threatening the Argos Colonists. I need you to land your forces there and take control of the situation. I hear the Colonists like to do something they call "surfing". You have two choices: you can fight or you can surf. I prefer you fight. Make them rue the day that they set their sights on Greece!

The war has come to Greece. \n \nBeorix has launched an assault on the city of Argos. This cannot be allowed to stand. I want you to lead the forces into the city and liberate it. Fight for every street, fight house to house. Do what you have to do to kick that rabid dog out of Argos!
It was a hard-won victory. Argos stands free again thanks to you. Fine work, my friend, fine work.
Don't give an inch of ground. Take the city back at all costs.
No mercy. Make Vemundr pay. Drive him from the city!
Another day, another cowardly brother flees. I and the people of Argos salute you.
Show the people of Argos we won't let them down. Push the Lackeys back and free the city.
Go tell the Spartans. Go tell them that their home is safe. Their proud city still stands thanks to you. Tales of your valor will still be sung hundreds of years from now.
Take and hold key positions throughout the city while pushing Beorix out.
Sparta is now ours and Vemundr flees in terror. No one can stand in our way! Muhahaha!
Push forward with all forces. Do not stop until the city is taken and Vemundr is defeated.
As always, you have done well. The warriors of Sparta now look at you with true respect.

So here at last, on the shores of the great sea, comes the end of our fellowship... err I mean the end of our long campaign. \n \nWe have Beorix and his Lackeys trapped on the coast. He has nowhere left to run now. I want you to lead the men in and take him out once and for all. His rampage of destruction and terror ends today!

Wodan be praised! Beorix is no more! News of this great victory already spreads to all corners of the world. The people rejoice at the mention of your name. It has been an honor to serve with you. I am proud to call you friend!
Total victory is now within our grasp. Press forward and eliminate Beorix and all of his forces.

Can you hear it? Nothing. The cries of the seagulls have been silenced, the dead are avenged. \n \nYou have done all I have asked and more, my friend. Hope would have been lost without you. The people owe you a debt that can never be repaid. Rest now--you have earned it.

Vemundr is here in Argos you say? \n \nHe tasks me. He tasks me and I shall have him! I'll chase him 'round Mount Olympus and 'round the Aegean Sea and 'round the forests of Dacia before I give him up! March on the city and take it! Don't let anything stand in your way, especially Vemundr!

Our forces are stretched thin thanks to Beorix. \n \nOne of his brothers, of which there seems to be an endless supply, has circled back on us and attacked Argos again. I am calling upon you one more time to get in there and teach him a lesson he won't soon forget. Sad thing is, he does seem to forget because this keeps on happening!

No one ever said that Beorix was smart. \n \nHe attacks Sparta, home to some of the finest warriors in the world. Brilliant. Trouble is, most of them are off fighting elsewhere. I need you to lead our forces into the city and make sure Beorix is unable to take it. Show the Spartans how great of a warrior you happen to be... by defending their home!

Sparta. I laugh at Sparta. \n \n"Home of the greatest warriors in the world?" Time to show them what true warriors are like. Better yet, that bug Vemundr is here as well. Kill two birds with one stone, I say. Capture the city and defeat Vemundr while you're at it. Time to put him in his place.

Greece is in chaos. There is now fighting on several fronts. \n \nWord has just arrived that another brother of Beorix has decided to make an appearance and is attempting to take Sparta again. Yes, yes, I know-as often as we've had to fight them, there must be 300 brothers. Regardless, take your forces and secure the city. Drive his brother out of it!
Capture and hold the Victory Towers and Treasuries throughout the city. Chief Vemundr must be near these buildings to capture them.
