Protect the River Merchants' Market from Marauders.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
Kill the Marauder Captains.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
Quickly destroy all Docks belonging to the Followers of Autolycus.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
Agamemnon would like you to destroy the Temples of Troy to quell the locals.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
King Agamemnon wants you you destroy King Thyestes's Wonder.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
Defeat all enemies to control all three of the large islands.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.
Kill Slingers, destroy the Training Camps, and kill the Badari War Leaders responsible for this nuisance.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.

Legendary: Beorix Returns
Lose No Victory Towers
Win a City Defense Without Ever Being Behind In Points

Not long ago, Celtic Wanderers began appearing in our lands, fleeing from something in the south. \n \nThey are violating our territory and blocking vital trade routes-acts of war. Lead a contingent of Norse troops into the area, establish a base, and then clear it of Celtic Wanderers.
Complete all four City Conquest game mode quests with a friend.
Complete all four City Conquest game mode quests without losing any captured Victory Towers.
Flawless Conquest
Big Victory
Vemundr Stands Alone
Win a City Defense game mode quest without ever falling behind the enemy on Victory Points.
Front Runner
There Can Be Only One
Defender of the Universe
Complete a lot of City Defense game mode quests.
Dog Gauntlet
Guide Chief Vemundr through the high mountain pass, and clear out the enemy factories.
Ha! That will show Beorix things won't be as easy as he thought!
Defend the ally Sacred Grove. Use the Training Camp for units and upgrades.

While we have been busy elsewhere, Beorix's Brother has decided to slip behind us and attempt to recapture the Village of Sens. \n \nIt could be Beorix's 12th cousin once removed, for all I care--you need to get in there and show the people of Sens that they can always count on us to aid them.

A new power is rising. Its road to victory is at hand!\n \nToday, the ground will be stained with the blood of Beorix and his Lackeys. March to the Village of Sens and confront them there. Leave none alive! To war!
The Village of Sens is free! Never will it fall to the tyranny of Beorix!

Do you hear that buzzing? It's that annoying little fly Vemundr again. Time to put him in his place. \n \nThe Village of Sens looks ripe for the picking. Lead my Lackeys into the place and plant a hammer square in Vemundr's skull. These people need to know when they're conquered.
Will these people never learn? Now that their precious "leader" has been sent packing maybe they will wake up. The Village of Sens is ours.
It seems that Beorix's whole family is a bunch of smelly loudmouths. Good to see the Village of Sens is free once again of their stench.
How many brothers does Beorix have? No matter, we'll defeat them all.
You must keep up the pressure and drive Beorix from the Village of Sens!
Vemundr needs to be put in his place.

Capture and hold the Victory Towers and Treasuries throughout the city. War Leader Beorix must be near these buildings to capture them.\n \nThis quest is very challenging for solo play. Co-op is recommended.

This seems to be a recurring theme.\n \nBeorix's Brother has decided to slip behind us and attempt to recapture Crete. Which brother it is this time, I have no clue, but you need to get in there and show the people of Crete that they can always count on us to aid them.
What a great sight it is to see Beorix's Brother running to the sea and trying to swim in all of that armor! At least the fish will get a meal. Once again, fine work. All of Crete thanks you.
Boot Beorix's Brother out of Sparta. Take and hold key points throughout the city.
Confront the Lackeys of Beorix along the Greek coast and defeat his forces once and for all.
War Leader Beorix Must Survive
You did well to get you and your men through enemy held territory to save the outpost. No one ever said war was fair.
The area is thick with the enemy. It will be a tough fight to reach the Dacian Outpost.
The Lackeys of Beorix have made another mistake. \n \nThey have allowed their army to be trapped along the coast. Lead our forces into battle and destroy this Lackey army. Wodan go with you.
The Lackey army has been destroyed. Let us celebrate this great victory! Well done, my friend, well done.
Press the attack and don't let up until all Lackey forces have been destroyed.

Vemundr now flees from the flames of his defeat. I especially relish the fact you have done worse than kill him, you have hurt him. I wish you to go on hurting him. He will not soon recover from the loss of Argos.
Allied Assault

Throughout the ages, many of the finest warriors often worked together to overcome an enemy. \n \nThis still holds true on the battlefields of today. Only by gaining an ally to aid you can total victory be achieved.
Excellent work! I shall compose a ballad to celebrate your victory!
Ha ha! I knew it was you! Let this not be the last great deed you accomplish!
Show no mercy! Scatter your enemy to the four winds!
My eyes have seen no sight more beautiful than your taking that city the way you did. You are truly a god among men.
You and your men will need to fight well to capture the city.
The song that I heard must have been about you! You continue to personify the legends of old. Well done!
Honor is the mark of a great warrior, and you are one of the greats. You have resisted the call of gold when so many others could not. Bravo!
Gold holds a strange power over men. Do not fall into its deadly trap.

My epic is nearly complete. \n \nIt tells the story of a man that represented the gods themselves, traveling the lands and achieving victory after victory on the field of battle. I have decided to base this epic on you, my friend. I believe that when history is done with you it will show you were unmatched in combat. May you never face defeat!
Only those blessed by the gods themselves can achieve victory after victory.

Alas, there will be time to rest later. \n \nScouts have reported that Beorix's forces are on the move once again, this time they actually mean to attack the city of Sparta! We must cross the mountains to beat him there. The pass we will use is most certainly guarded. The pass must be cleared of all enemy forces before we move on to Sparta!
With the pass cleared, we have an unopposed road to Sparta. Beorix is in for a huge surprise when he sees us there waiting for him. Well done!
The mountains conceal many enemies. It will be quite the undertaking to find and destroy them all.

Beorix continues his march to the south. \n \nHis Lackeys have captured docks along the coast and are using them to ferry soldiers to Greece. Lead our forces into battle and make sure each of those docks is destroyed. We must prevent this war from spreading even further.
With the docks out of commission, we have deprived Beorix of the ships he needed to carry his war further south. Well done.

Bah! Are the very gods themselves against us? \n \nWord has just reached me that Beorix and much of his Lackey force managed to find other ships and sail south! His target appears to be Crete. I will need you to lead a force there to ensure Beorix fails in his plan to conquer the city. Wodan speed your journey!

Only time will tell if we have stopped Beorix and his war of conquest. Failing to gain Crete has certainly dealt him a blow from which it will take him time to recover, at the very least. Excellent work my friend.
The Cauldron of War
Don't Reach Age III
Don't Reach Age IV
I did not think it possible! You are truly a master tactician. Well done! Now could you hand me my lute over there? I need to write a song commemorating this event.

I think it's high time to flex our Norse muscle! \n \nI want you to build me a big boat, but not on the water! Har har! The place I want it built is crawling with Celtic Wanderers. You will need to hold them off while the wonder is completed. Once it is, the Celts will flee in terror!

Can you hear the cries of the seagulls? They weep for all of those lives lost in this war. Those lives will all be avenged today! \n \nBeorix has made a critical error and our time to attack has come. We have surrounded the last of his Lackeys on the coast. More importantly, we have learned Beorix yet lives and is commanding them. This war ends today!
Race Race Vemundr!
Race Vemundr Race!

Chief Vemundr To Location

Complete a Quest From the Ambassador in Your Friend's City
Ultimate Warrior
I have faith in your alliance. You must work together to succeed!

Are you eager for perfection?\n \nI know of a warrior off to the East who was blessed with foresight in battle. Throughout his career, once he claimed a territory in battle, it remained under his control without fail. His conquests were flawless. Dare you attempt to equal his accomplishments? There is surely a song in it for you.
How are things coming along?

There is a rumor going around among the local villagers.\n \nA warrior has a appeared who has the reputation of crushing all that oppose him, showing no mercy. You wouldn't know anything about that would you?
A true warrior, indeed! I am honored to have witnessed such a stunning example. I am humbled by your presence.
Always stay ahead of your enemy. To fall behind means certain defeat.

Do you like gold?\n \nI know that it is always tempting to pillage a city of its gold, but the legends speak of one clan leader who never became too greedy as he sacked an enemy city. Can you bring this legend to life and do the same? Resist the temptation!

Have you ever heard the tale of the Lone Warrior?\n \nHis prowess in battle was so great that he was able to capture an entire city with only the aid of a handful of men. Do you think you could follow in his footsteps and do the same?

In my lifetime I have only seen a handful of true warriors.\n \nWhat made them true warriors? They went into battle with nothing but the clothes on their back and a weapon. Perhaps you will equal this feat? Use no upgrades to defeat the enemy and prove yourself a true warrior.
In all of my days I have never had the privilege to meet victory personified until now. I bow to your magnificence. My epic will carry your name throughout history.
The air is heavy with the scent of battle.

I remember a song I once heard about a battle for a city.\n \nThe warrior who was defending the city was always three moves ahead of the enemy. He was never in any danger of losing. Do you think you would be able to do the same if it came to it?
Cities Defended
Win All City Conquests Without Losing Any Captured Victory Towers
Sens

There is troubling news from the North. 
 
The drums of war have begun to beat in the lands of the Norse, a hardy people on both the land and sea. A call has gone out for heroes and commanders such as yourself lend them aid.
 
Speak with the Port Master in the Northern Hold as soon as you arrive.

Your journey was not too harsh I hope! No matter, it is good that you have arrived.\n \nCeltic Wanderers are streaming into our lands from the South. We need a strong commander like you to take control of the situation.

Beorix has truly gone mad! \n \nHe now marches south as we speak, into the Celtic homelands, leaving behind a swath of destruction. We need the support of the Celts if we are to have a chance at stopping him. Defend the Sacred Grove. Use the Training Camp for units and upgrades. Luck be with you!
Excellent! The Celts should now lend us their support in defeating War Leader Beorix and his Lackeys. Hopefully we can end this war soon.
You must turn the tide in this war.
Sneak, Sail, and Smash!

Lackeys of Beorix are threatening a Dacian outpost to the east. This outpost must not fall!\n \nThis is a chance for you to show the rest of the world these Norse troublemakers won't be allowed to do as they please. Muster what forces you can and defend that outpost at all costs!
War Leader Beorix Killed
Beorix's Brother Killed
The race is on!
I though you said you were up for the race?
Just in the nick of time! A fine race, indeed.

Do you like races?
 
I hope you do. One of the brothers of War Leader Beorix has challenged us to compete in a Norse traditional smash-and-crash race. The basic idea is to run as fast as you can at a series of walls. Break down the walls and then reach the end zone before your competitor.
 
It can be painful, but it's lots of fun to watch.

So, it looks like another brother of War Leader Beorix thinks he has what it takes to beat you in a not-so-friendly game of smash-and-crash. As before, you will need to run as fast as you can at a series of walls. Break down the walls and then reach the end zone before your competitor.\n \nI'll be cheering for you--unless you want to refuse the challenge.
Your skills are growing! I doubt there will ever be a brother of Beorix who can beat you. Although somehow I suspect more will try.
Defeat Beorix's Brother in a smash-and-crash race. Run as fast as you can across the mountain pass and destroy all towers in your path.

All City Conquests Completed in Coop

What war do I speak of? 
 
It began months ago when the brutal War Leader Beorix raised an army and started laying waste to village after village.
 
Aid me in showing these people that all hope is not lost. Together we can rally and turn the tide of this war. Wodan grant us strength!
Elite, Elite, Elite!

Up for some crazy challenges?\n \nYou see, my fellow Port Masters and I host a fairly regular contest. It's a friendly sort of thing. Nothing too dangerous, and anyone who tells you otherwise is lying. The contest is simple: whichever of us is the Port Master for the most daring leader wins a boat-load of treasure. I'll cut you in for a share if you step it up!
Complete enough Elite quests to win the Port Masters content.
Step it up! Elite, elite, elite!
We won! Here's your cut.

Ora che conosciamo i traditori, dobbiamo agire in fretta. Re Agamemnon, Brennos e Re Thyestes, non ti vedranno mai venire. \n \nPrendeteli senza preoccupazioni e batterli sul campo di battaglia. Non sarà facile, ma ti fidiamo di te.
Buon lavoro, i traditori furono sconfitti e solo dovevano fuggire dalla battaglia.

Unfortunately, not everyone prospers under peace. The Allies military is bored, and that makes for an easy target. Rebellious factions are securing the aid of Generals and becoming more dangerous than ever. 
 
These Generals have lost their way and will not return. Punish them!
